description.narrative:
1. Increased access to finance to MSMEs in Low Income States: FICCL provides financing to the underserved MSME segment which lacks financial access even today. The Low Income States (LIS) in particular has historically been under financed despite having housed a significant percentage of MSMEs. IFC debt is expected to expand FICCL's reach in LIS and increase MSME portfolio.
2. Building further capacity in affordable housing finance: FIHFC provides affordable housing finance to the low-mid income borrowers with an average ticket size of INR 1.7mn (~US$ 25000). It plans to cater primarily to the under banked geographies by leveraging the network of its parent FICCL. IFC investment is expected to help it scale its affordable housing portfolio.
3. Job Creation: MSMEs in India employ close to 40% of the workforce. Access to credit for these entities helps them achieve scale while enhancing sector competitiveness and job creation

(FICCL, the Company)/ Fullerton India Home Finance Company Limited (FIHFC) for on-lending to micro, small and medium enterprise (MSME ), sectors and business permitted under applicable laws/regulations. Established in 2007, FICCL is a leading Non-Banking Finance Company registered with Reserve Bank of India. The Company has a strong focus on lending to rural and urban micro and small enterprises and also caters to mid-sized SMEs. FICCL also offers loans for affordable housing to salaried and self-employed individuals through it is fully owned subsidiary FIHFC. As of Dec 31, 2016, FICCL has total assets under management of around US$ 1.88 billion and has reached out to more than 1.6 million customers through a widespread network of 528 branches spread across 22 states & 3 union territories, reaching out to 600 towns and 48,000 villages in the country.
